Item.Title: 3 Lle
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: Television and radio presenter Ifan Jones Evans is proud of his Ceredigion roots. For this episode of '3 Lle', we begin the journey at 'Rhosyrhiw' farm near Pontrhydygroes, which was where his grandparents farmed, and where he now lives with his young family. Cwm Cell, where both his and his parents' farm are based, is full of memories of a happy rural upbringing. His second location is in a different field altogether, at Pontrhydfendigaid Football Club. Ifan has been playing for the Club for over 18 years, the club has recently celebrated its 70 year anniversary. We move on to the Royal Welsh Showground for his third choice, a place of personal and professional significance, he began his television career here, working firstly behind the scenes, before moving to the front of camera.
Item.Billing: Television and radio presenter Ifan Jones Evans is proud of his Ceredigion roots. We begin the journey to his three places of personal significance at Rhosyrhiw farm near Pontrhydygroes. His second location is in a different field altogether, at Pontrhydfendigaid Football Club. We move on to the Royal Welsh Showground for his third choice where he began his television career.

In this programme the aim is trying to please a group of Cardiff students who love food but can't afford all the delights in the Capital.

Item.Title: Iaith ar Daith
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: Iaith ar Daith (language road trip) returns to S4C in 2021. This year another six intrepid celebrity Welsh learners hit the road and travel the length and breadth of the country facing different linguistic challenges. Helping them along the way will be a celebrity mentor/friend- a fluent Welsh speaker who is there to encourage and explain. An entertaining series full of passion and determination which proves that anyone has the ability to start their journey to learn a new language.In the second programme the two actresses Rakie Ayola and Eiry Thomas hit the road.

Item.Title: Dechrau Canu Dechrau Canmol
Item.Synopsis: This week we mark one of the most important festivals of the Islamic calendar, Ramadan.
Item.Billing: This week we mark one of the most important festivals of the Islamic calendar, Ramadan. We hear from a young Cardiff girl, Aleena Khan, about her experience of Ramadan since her teens, and from Ameer Davies-Rana who is following Ramadan for the first time this year.

Item.Title: Ffilmiau Ddoe
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: Dilwyn Morgan and his guests delve into the National Library of Wales' Screen and Sound Archive to look at some home-movies and early comedies. Siwan Haf will take a nostalgic look at films made by members of her own family, including scenes from Nefyn in the 1930's and Niwbwrch in the 1950's, before watching films about Pwllheli on market day in 1960, and the Talybont Show. Tony Llewelyn will look at some early comedies by pioneering film-maker William Haggar, as well as innovative light-dramas filmed around Dinas Mawddwy in the 1930's, featuring local people.
Item.Billing: Dilwyn Morgan, Tony Llewelyn and Siwan Haf enjoy early slapstick comedies and nostalgic home-movies from The National Library of Wales' Screen and Sound Archive.

Item.Title: Cerys Matthews a'r Goeden Faled
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: In the second episode of Y Goeden Faled, Cerys Matthews continues her journey to discover the roots of some of Wales' most well-known folk songs. Who was Dafydd y Garreg Wen ('David of The White Rock')? Cerys travels to Borth-y-Gest in search of the famous white rock and to find out why the song became popular throughout Wales and beyond. Cerys also visits the Eglwyswrw area to learn more about the characters and locations in the song, Y Mochyn Du, and looks at the history of the harp in Wales in the company of Llio Rhydderch and Gwenan Gibbard.
Item.Billing: Cerys Matthews continues her journey to discover the roots of some of Wales's most well-known folk songs - Dafydd y Garreg Wen ('David of The White Rock') and Y Mochyn Du. We will also learn about the history of the harp in Wales.

Item.Title: Chwaraeon y Dyn Bach

Item.Synopsis: James Lusted loves sport and in this series he'll meet other athletes who will prove that disabilities are no bar to participating - and excelling - in a variety of different disciplines. In the first programme he meets Paralympic star Aled Sion Davies. he'll hear how Gerwyn Owen develops talent for Disability Sport Wales, and he'll play football with Josh Law from Cardiff City F.C. And as she prepares for the School Games in Loughborough, he'll learn how Fran Smith from Caernarfon overcame her condition to become one of the rising stars of British wheelchair tennis.

Item.Billing: James Lusted meets Paralympic star Aled Siôn Davies. He hears how Gerwyn Owen develops talent for Disability Sport Wales and plays football with Josh Law from Cardiff City F.C. And as she prepares for the School Games in Loughborough, Fran Smith from Caernarfon explains how she overcame her condition to become one of the rising stars of British wheelchair tennis.

Item.Synopsis: A series following the journey of father and son, Wayne and Connagh Howard, around some of the islands of Wales. Although they have travelled the world, we will follow the two of them as they discover strange and unexpected parts of Wales! In this programme, the two learn how to paddle-board around Ynys Gifftan near Portmeirion;, visit the grave of a very special person at St. Cynhaearn's Church at Ynyscynhaearn; and spend an exclusive night on Shell Island - the largest campsite in Europe.
Item.Mood_Scene_Info: BOP = 1' 39" cyflwyniad i'r gyfres - Connagh yn ysgrifennu efo'i droed ar dywod yna clipiau o'r gyfres a throslais/1' 39" pre title intro . Connagh writing on the sand with his foot followed by clips from the series + v/o EOP 1- Tese i rhan 2 - roced bychan yn cael ei lawnsio ar Ynys Mochras yna caption/Part 2 tease -small rocket launched on Ynys Mochras followed by caption BOP 2- Caption yna re-cap rhan 1/Caption followed by part 1 re-cap EOP -Cydnabyddiaethau ac "End holder"/End credits followed by end holder
Item.Billing: A series following the journey of father and son, Wayne and Connagh Howard, around some of Wales' islands. In this programme, they go paddle boarding around Ynys Gifftan; visit a very important gravestone; and spend an exclusive night on Europe's largest campsite!

Item.Title: Bach a Mawr
Item.Synopsis: One sunny morning Mawr decides to go and investigate the road outside their house. Bach is excited and packs his case ready for the journey. But it's a long process, going backwards and forwards forgetting things. The journey progresses very slowly and before long night falls. They look back at the house and find it very welcoming. So they decide to turn back and leave the journey for another day.
Item.Billing: Big decides to explore the road outside their house. Small brings along the bed for comfort.

Item.Title: Sion y Chef
Item.Synopsis: A series about an energetic chef called Siôn who lives in the seaside village Pentre Bach with his daughter Izzy. They both love to create recipes together. Mario has been left in charge of Sam Spratt's dog, Elis, but in his excitement Elis runs off. Will Mario find the dod before Sam returns?
Item.Billing: Mario has been left in charge of Sam Spratt's dog, Elis, but in his excitement Elis runs off. Will Mario find the dod before Sam returns?

Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: It's a lovely, sunny day at Hafod Haul farm, and Heti and Jaff decide to go blackberry picking. While Heti pops back to the house to fetch her gardening gloves, she leaves the basket on the farmyard. Spotting that this is a good opportunity to play a trick, Cadi and Caio the little horses decide to hide the basket. Jaff cannot understand what's happened, and eventually finds the basket in the pigsty. Minutes later the horses see another opportunity for some more fun, and decide to hide the basket again, and this time they throw it into the duck pond. Heti and Jaff are not impressed, but go ahead to collect a basket full of juicy blackberries. Heti then decides to make a blackberry tart, and shares a piece with the animals. Unfortunately there is nothing left for Cadi and Caio , and the two little horses learn a hard lesson for playing tricks.
Item.Billing: Heti and Jaff decide to go blackberry picking. But when the basket goes missing, will Jaff find out who has been playing tricks.

Item.Title: Caru Canu
Item.Synopsis: Youngsters love to sing and delight in singing along to their favourite songs with friends and family. 'Caru Canu' will give them the opportunity to watch and sing along to popular beautifully animated Welsh nursery rhymes and songs, whilst learning about animals, gestures, counting and the weather. And to those in need of a little 'quiet time', there are lullabies to help them sleep too! A traditional nursery song about rainy weather and ways to shelter from the rain.
Item.Billing: This lovely animated series offers an opportunity to sing traditional and contemporary songs and rhymes while learning about animals, gestures, counting and the weather. And for those who need 'quiet time' there are nursery rhymes to help them sleep too! This time: a traditional, joyful song introducing animals.

Item.Billing: The Little Princess learns why she shouldn't play football indoors.

Lleucu prepares to take a photograph of Mawr on the Swing with Small bunji jumping into a frame beside him, but thinks dont quite go according to plan, with only one shot left in the camera! Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: The ducks at Hafod Haul farm are a happy lot, enjoying life on the lake. Ben is also usually a very happy duck, friends with everyone, and always in the know with what's going on at the farm. However, today, Ben is feeling quite sad, and thinks that he has no talent like the other animals. Pedol is a big strong horse, able to carry Heti on his back when they go riding; Jaff can run swiftly after the sheep; and the hens lay fresh eggs every day. Despite their reassurances, none of the animals manage to cheer up Ben, and he is feeling quite low and useless when he returns to the lake. Later that day, whilst feeding the ducks, Heti loses her favourite bracelet in the water. No one else can help her find it, but Ben dives into the water and recovers the missing bracelet. Ben has a special talent after all, and Heti is so grateful to him.
Item.Billing: Ben is feeling sad that he has no special talent. But when no one else can help Heti find her favourite bracelet, Ben dives deep into the water and recovers it.

Item.Billing: This lovely animated series offers an opportunity to sing traditional and contemporary songs and rhymes while learning about animals, gestures, counting and the weather. And for those who need 'quiet time' there are nursery rhymes to help them sleep too! A lively song that - with some animal assistance - helps little ones count to three.

Item.Mood_Scene_Info: BOP - 2' 28" IV tease i'r gyfres gan Ifan Jones Evans ynghyd ag amrywiol glipiau cyn y teitl/ 2'28" IV tease to the series by Ifan Jones Evans along with various clips from the seies prior to series title. EOP 1 - Troslais tease i rhan dau ynghyd a chlipiau o'r dasg adeiladu berfa yna caption/V/O tease to part two along with clips of the whee-barrow building task followed by caption BOP 2 - Caption yna IV croeso nol gan Ifan Jones Evans/Caption followed by IV welcome back from Ifan Jones Evans EOP 2 - Troslais tease i rhan tri ynghyd a chlipiau o dasg mecofer i oen yna caption/V/O tease to part three along with clips of the make-over for a lamb task followed by caption BOP 3 - Caption yna IV croeso nol gan Ifan Jones Evans/Caption followed by IV welcome back from Ifan Jones Evans EOP 3 - Troslais tease i rhan pedwar ynghyd a chlipiau o'r dasg blasu cig yna caption/V/O tease to part four along with clips of the tasting task followed by caption BOP 4 -Caption yna IV croeso nol gan Ifan Jones Evans/Caption followed by IV welcome back from Ifan Jones Evans EOP - Cydnabyddiaethau ac "End holder" /End credits followed by end holder.

Item.Title: Bach a Mawr
Item.Synopsis: Mawr announces that his celery is ready to be picked. Bach thinks that this is cause for celebration by announcing that it's Celery Day ! and that Mawr should write a song in honour of the crispy vegetable. But Mawr cant seem to reach the sixth note. Bach tries to help by dressing up as a Celery for inspiration. This isn't sucessful, so they decided to eat the celery anyway. The crunching inspires a tune and soon Big and Small are singing out the best ever Celery Day Song.
Item.Billing: Mawr wants to write a song celebrating celery and Bach helps his friend with a little inspiration.

Item.Title: Sion y Chef
Item.Synopsis: A series about an energetic chef called Siôn who lives in the seaside village Pentre Bach with his daughter Izzy. They both love to create recipes together. Siôn wants to make apple fool for his special of the day, but when goat Menna eats all the apples he has to find a replacement ingredient.
Item.Billing: Siôn wants to make apple fool for his special of the day, but when goat Menna eats all the apples he has to find a replacement ingredient.

Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: The animals are all worried at Hafod Haul farm today. Jaff has overheard Heti on the phone saying that somebody must leave the farm. But who? Who has made Heti so cross that she would want them to leave? In their turn all the animals give their reasons why everything points at them . Cled the cockerel remembers when he crowed so loudly by Heti's bed when she slept late one morning, that she fell out of bed in fright! Cadi and Caio the little horses remember the time they went into the house and broke a plate in the kitchen, and also painted themselves as zebras. Pedol, reminds us that he once made Heti cross when he ate the flowers from the garden; Ben the duck took a bath in the bathroom; and the pigs stole Heti's sheets from the washing line and played ghosts! And what about Gwen the goat? She is convinced that she may be the one who will be sent to the moon because she once borrowed Heti's best hat, and went for a walk to the village pub. In time, after much worrying they find out that Pws the cat is the one who has to leave - for the simple reason that she can go to see the vet because of a bad leg. Everybody is very relieved that no-one has to be sent away to live on the moon after all.
Item.Billing: Jaff has overheard Heti on the telephone saying someone must leave the farm today, and all the animals arel worried it could be them.

We will also learn what effect the Romany had on folk music in Wales as we meet a descendant of a very musical family. Join Cerys as she travels across the country learning more about the characters that have changed our folk music history.

Item.Title: Cymru, Dad a Fi
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: A series following the journey of father and son, Wayne and Connagh Howard, around some of the islands of Wales. Although they have travelled the world, we will follow the two of them as they discover strange and unexpected parts of Wales! In the last programme of the series, the two have a very 'ghostly' experience at Machynys; an exhilarating trip to Wales' most Southerly island, Flatholm in the Bristol Channel; visit an area which is very important to Wayne in the centre of Cardiff; before finishing their journey on Wales' most popular 'island' - Barry Island.
Item.Mood_Scene_Info: BOP - Connagh yn ysgrifennu at dywod gyda'i droed/ Connagh writing on the sand with his foot followed by clips from the series + v/o EOP 1- Tese i rhan 2 - ffwtej o aelodau The Rainbow Club Caerdydd yna caption/Part 2 tease -footage of Rainbow Club Cardiff followed by caption BOP 2- Caption yna re-cap rhan 1/Caption followed by part 1 re-cap EOP -Cydnabyddiaethau ac "End holder"/End credits followed by end holder
Item.Billing: A series following the journey of father and son, Wayne and Connagh Howard, around some of the islands of Wales. In the last programme of the series, they have a 'ghostly' experience at Machynys; an exhilarating ride across to Flatholm Island, and a visit to Wales' most popular island - Barry Island!

Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: The animals are eagerly awaiting their breakfast at Hafod Haul farm, but where is Heti? The chicks decide to go looking for her on the farmyard. On entering the shed they discover that a big orange monster is in there and it's eating Heti! Word gets out to all the other animals, and they are all anxious to save Heti from the monster's grasp. Jaff bravely enters the shed, but cannot find any monsters, and after searching further he eventually finds Heti who is fixing the engine of the tractor. There is a lot of leg pulling in the hen house that night, and the chicks feel very silly for their mistake.
Item.Billing: The little chicks discover a big orange monster in the shed, and it's eating Heti! Will the other animals manage to save her in time?

Item.Synopsis: Bach wants to prove if the Gwelf really exists. So they decide to set a recording machine in the garden. But Lleucu uses it, and accidentally causes it to malfunction. The sound coming from itleads Bach and Mawr to beleive that it's the sound of the Gwelff. Lleucu denies touching the machine. So Bach and Mawr set off to the forest to search for the Gwelff, this is a worry for Lleucu and she admits to lying, and apologises. After repairing the machine Bach and Mawr listen to Lleucu's song, and they are all friends again.

Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: Heti likes nothing better than going hoseriding. But one day, she notices that Pedol has lost a horseshoe. She phones the blacksmith so that he can come to fit a new shoe , and all the animals are in awe watching the blacksmith at work , but Pedol assures them that it doesn't hurt in the slightest. Meanwhile Pws feels that she and the other animals have been unfairly treated. After all they haven't received new shoes or anything else for that matter. In the end they realize that Heti is kind to everyone and that there is no need for them to be jealous of Pedol.
Item.Billing: It's an exciting day at Hafod Haul farm when the blacksmith comes to give Pedol a new horseshoe.

Item.Title: Trefi Gwyllt Iolo
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Serious Factual
Item.Billing: In the last in the series, Iolo Williams looks for town wildlife all over Wales. In a Pontypool garage he comes across a false widow spider which can sometimes give a nasty bite. Mice have made a home in a garage in Colwyn Bay and a hedgehog visits a garden for his nightly supper in Deri in the Darran Valley. Also in the programme, he sees birds making use of roof tops in Blaenau Ffestiniog, Aberystwyth and Llanrwst.

Item.Title: Codi Hwyl America
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Hobbies & Leisure
Item.Mood_Scene_Info: Diwedd rhan 1: John a Dilwyn yn eistedd ar gadeiriau siglo. Rhan 2: Harbwr Llyn Erie.
Item.Billing: Welsh actor John Pierce Jones and comedian Dilwyn Morgan are on a road trip around the USA where they take part in the annual festivities of the Tuscarora Nation - a Native American tribe celebrating its culture with music, dance and a game of Fireball - a bit like rugby - except the goalposts and ball are literally in flames. The pair charter a sailboat for an excursion on one of the Great Lakes with dramatic consequences when John unexpectedly offers to dock the boat.

Item.Title: Welsh Whisperer: Ni'n Teithio Nawr
Item.Synopsis: A series of programmes following the Welsh Whisperer on his journey through rural villages of Wales meeting characters of whom are integral to their local communities keeping village life alive. The series comes to an end at Drefach Felindre famous for its woollen mill industry of past but thrives as an industrious rural village today. The series ends with a song with local entertainer Dafydd "Pantrhod" Davies.
Item.Billing: Series of programmes following the Welsh Whisperer on his journey through rural villages of Wales, meeting characters who are integral to their local communities. The series comes to an end at Drefach Felindre, famous for its woollen mill industry. Today it thrives as an industrious, community-minded rural village.

Item.Title: Noson Lawen
Item.Synopsis: Ifan Jones Evans introduces a Noson Lawen featuring artists from the north of Ceredigion. There is a family theme going on in tonight's programme as Ifan welcomes his big brother, the tenor Robyn Lyn Evans and his wife Aneira to perform on the show along with the middle brother in the Evans family, Dewi Sion, who sings a well-known and very popular duet with his friend Barry Powell. Sian James, Meinir Gwilym, Gwyneth Glyn and Gwenan Gibbard are well known faces as soloists on the Noson Lawen, but tonight they morph as the new group 'Pedair'. With a successful career in musical theatre, Sam Ebenezer returns home from London to perform and the Welsh Whisperer delights the audience with his quirky performance. Musician Rhys Taylor, local talent Steffan Rees and students from Pantycelyn fill the stage and the theatre with stunning performances.
